11.content:
The board on the wall had the name Tiffany Jones on it next to the name patient. As your eyes continued to wonder the room, which looked almost exactly like the one you had been in as you died, your doctor and the nurse who had ran out when you awoke entered the room. "How are you feeling Samuel?" He asked.

"A, a little woozy" you answered, your voice obviously sounding different and very dry.

"That's to be expected with a procedure like this one"

"So, tell me doc. Who am I now?" You asked.

"Well, that's the question of the day now isn't it" he replied as he handed you a cup of water with a straw. "Here, sip on this"

You did as he said, and after taking a sip you said "I'd say so". It was at this time that you truly noticed just how different your voice was, sounding softer and clearly feminine.

"Well, as for whose body your in the answer is, we don't know. She was brought to us by the police shortly after you lost consciousness. We preformed some brain scans that revealed that she was essentially brain dead. When we asked for her identification, we were informed that she had none. She was found in a shipping container with several other girls. Now, as for who you will be, that's a simpler question. You will still be Sam Baker, however it will be Samantha rather than Samuel"

"That's not so bad"

"I figured as much. Now for some, bad news"

"What bad news?"

"You see, based on everything we can tell you are now a 15 year old girl. Because we need someone to observe you while you recover and the government doesn't want someone who looks like a 15 year old girl to be living on her own, your going to have to appear as someone's daughter. As you know, your an only child and both your parents have passed away, so shortly after the procedure we contacted your ex-wife and asked if she could be your legal guardian"

"What?" You shouted, almost spitting the water you had been sipping on.

"The government won't let a 15 year old girl appear to be living on her own. It would raise to many questions and this is a procedure that has to be kept on the down low. But once your old enough you can move out and you'll have access to your bank account the whole time"

"Well, I guess that it could be worse" you say. "Could, could I have some time to myself"

"Of course. If you need anything just hit the call button here and a nurse will be here in no time at all" he said before he left, followed by the nurse.

Shortly after they left I found a tv remote and turned the rooms tv on. Being that it was the middle of the day there wasn't much on so I settled on the news. However, it wasn't long before that got boring and my eyes began wondering the room. Eventually they found their way to the far corner of the room where my clothes I had worn here were neatly folded and sitting on a chair, with my phone and wallet sitting on top of them. Carefully, I threw off the blankets covering my body and stepped down on the floor. As I stood up I felt a wave of new feelings as my new parts were effected by gravity. Looking down, my vision was blocked by a pair of breasts covered by a hospital gown. Getting sidetracked for a minute I carefully walked over to my rooms bathroom, my hips swaying from side to side uncontrollably with each step I took.

Once I was in the bathroom I stared at the mirror in absolute shock. Sure, the doctor told me I was a 15 year old girl now but actually seeing my reflection made it even more real. Seeing her eyes grow wide along with mine, or her jaw drop in sync with me, it just made me speechless. As I stood there, I began studying my reflections face in awe of who I now was. I studied her eyes, which were blue with green flecks though out the irises. Then there was the curve of her nose, smooth and seamless as if her face had been build only to support such a perfect structure. All this was framed by beautiful shoulder length blond hair. As my eyes wondered further down, I couldn't help but stare at the breasts that would rise and fall with each breath I took. I carefully pulled the hospital gown up as I wanted a better look. With the gown pulled up I could admire the new assets now on my chest. They were still covered by a cheep hospital bra, but I could see enough. I placed an uneducated guess that they were a small B cup, and they would probably grow a bit more over the next few years.

I was slowly bringing one of my hands up to have a feel when I was snapped back to reality as I heard the door to my hospital room open. Who was it that entered the room?

114.content:
A young black man entered the room and looked around for others. Seeing I was the only other person present, he came over to the bathroom door.

A big smile appeared on his face.

"I KNEW it! I knew you could not be dead! I saw someone carry out your dress from this room and waited until I could make my move. It took more than a day, but here I am!"

Concerned by the intensity in his voice, I tried to placate the strange young man.

"Yup. Here you are alright, umm..."

"Man, you musta bumped your head good, huh?" Deep concern appeared on his face. "I'm Randy, remember? I'm your boyfriend!"

"My WHAT?" I said. How did the doctors let this kid get past them!

"They patched you up real pretty Tiffany, but I guess the accident did a number on your thinking, huh! Well, maybe I can fix that!"

I got the shock of my life when he reached out and pulled me close, wrapping his arms around me in what I thought was going to be a hug. I actually felt the breasts I had been admiring squish against his chest, and then this strange kid planted his lips on mine. I put my hands on his chest to shove him away but a strange thing happened.

I liked it.

I really liked it!
114.title: Randy Wayne

12.content:
Katie O'Brien the board says and you take a few moments to digest what that means. You stare up at the ceiling not trusting yourself to move yet. Just feeling the soft weight on your chest and the strange absence between your legs that tells you your life will never be the same.

"I'm a woman," you say to the ceiling your voice cracking forcing you to clear your throat.

"I'm a woman!" you try again your voice high and clear and strange, echoing in the small room.

You had known this was a possibility going in. The doctors had been very clear that they planned to give you the first donor body that became available and you had agreed. The rate your illness had been progressing you simply didn't have time to be picky. None the less waking up to find yourself without your Y chromosomes is an enormous shock. You feel queasy as a thousand questions press in on you at the same time.

How can you face your family like this?
Will you be able to return to your job?
Do you even have valid I.D. now?

You groan and cover your face trying to press away the tears that are stinging your eyes.

"There there, Mr Smith" a warm male voice reassures you "I understand this must be a very great shock for you but rest assured we are going to do everything we can to support you through this transition."

You open your eyes to see your doctor standing over you. He is probably trying to look calm and professional but he is coming across more than a little smug.

"Jackass" you think to yourself "Probably already writing his speech for the Nobel Prize."

Still, you don't want to seem ungrateful, he did save your life after all.

"Hi Doc" you say instead, trying to sound cheery "I guess your gadget worked then?"

"Yes Sam" he says practically beaming with pride "and we were fortunate enough to find a compatible donor in the knick of time."

"Yeah, and don't get me wrong I'm happy to still be here, but did you really have to put me in a woman?" you say tugging at the tangle of long hair that falls in your eyes.

"Of course" The Doctor nods "It wouldn't have been our first choice but beggars can't be choosers as the saying goes. And thanks to Ms O'Brien's donation you will get to live a long and healthy life, that's the thing to focus on here."

"Well, I guess it beats the alternative" You agree "It's just going to take some getting used to is all."

"That's the spirit," the Doc smiles down at you "Now we have some tests to run but first I think it would be a good idea if you met the new you first. That's if you feel up to it?"

Your heart hammers in your chest at the thought of confronting your new body but there doesn't seem like much point in putting it off. You nod and carefully avoid looking at yourself as the doctor helps you off the bed. You wobble on your new legs as you take a few shuffling steps. The doctor pulls back a curtain and you find yourself facing a full-length mirror facing the reflection of Katie O'Brien, your reflection now. You raise a trembling hand to your face as you see Katie is....
12.title: Katie Obrian

121.content:
You stare at the woman in the mirror, although girl might be a more accurate description, she is certainly no older twenty. Red hair falls past her shoulder framing her pale freckled face.
The shapeless hospital gown doesn't do her any favours but you can tell she's got a good figure under there. A bit on the skinny side for your taste but still, pretty nice.

It occurs to you that you are staring at this sweet young girl and you feel yourself blush. You watch the girl in the mirror as her cheeks flush red.

“God damn she's just a kid” you mutter to yourself.

The doctor hears your comment and gives a sad nod of agreement.

“It's always hard to see someone's life cut short. Especially someone so young.” his tone suggesting this is a speech he gives often “It's not uncommon for transplant patients to feel guilty about benefiting from such a tragedy. My advice is to try and remember that she chose to be a donor. She wanted her death, when it came, to count for something and it has. Remember that this project isn't just going to benefit you but thousands of people all over the world.”

That's a nice thought but you hadn't actually been worrying about that. You had been so busy admiring her young body it hadn't yet occurred to you to feel bad for surviving when she hadn't. You feel a pang of guilt for being so self centered and look away from the mirror.

“How old is she?” you ask looking up at the doctor “Or should I say how old am I now?”

“Before her accident Katie was…”
121.title: A pretty young redhead

1212.content:
"Before her accident, Katie was 17," the doctor tells you "She would have been 18 in a few more months."

"And her family?" You ask as he helps you back to the bed "It's hard to believe someone so young is all alone?"

"Her family were all killed in the same accident that put her in a coma," he tells you with a sad shake of his head. "Tragic really but it did make her an ideal candidate for this test.”

“Damn…” you sigh at the revelation that you are not even old enough to by beer. “But what does that mean for me? Will I be able to continue my own life or am I going to be forced to live as a teenage orphan?”

You are sure there had been something about this in the reams of forms they'd had you sign but your memory is still a little hazy. Luckily the doctor is on hand to jog your memory explaining that...

12121.content:
"Legally you are still you." the doc explains "This, ah, procedure doesn't change that any more than any other transplant would. Our legal team has been quite busy on this point. We've even been able to update your documentation to reflect your new appearance."

He hands you a drivers licence with Katie's picture and your name and address on it by way of an example. You stare at it struck by the realisation that you will not be able to simply vanish into Katie's life. For better or for worse you will have to face your friends and family with this new face. There are obvious benefits, you'll have access to your savings and you'll be able to move back into your old apartment but you can't imagine how people are going to react to the new you. Especially your ex-wife. She never thought you were much of a man, she'll probably find the idea that you are now a girl hilarious.

Suddenly it's all too overwhelming. Your head spins and your vision narrows to a dark tunnel. You are on the verge of fainting and if it wasn't for the doctor holding you up you'd probably fall. He lifts you easily and carries you back to the bed. Distantly you are aware of an odd fluttering in your stomach as he lays you on the clean covers and brushes long red hair out of your eyes. You don't remember him being so big or strong and you wonder if he has been working out.

"Oh you know I try and stay in shape." he chuckles and you feel your face heat up as you realise you spoke out loud. "But the important thing now is you get some rest. Your body is still very weak and you've got a busy day tomorrow."

You mumble a response that seems to satisfy him and he leaves turning out the light as he goes. You touch yourself under the covers marvelling at how smooth and sensitive your new skin is but you are too exhausted to do any real exploration. Instead, you let sleep claim you.
12121.title: You can return to your old life, more or less.

choices: The doctor has a surprise for you.
121211.content:
In your dream, you are sat in the passenger seat of an old sedan as it speeds down a long straight highway. Either side of the blacktop a barren dessert stretches out to the horizon. Looking down you see your familiar male body dressed in a hospital gown. Katie O'Brien sits behind the wheel wearing an elegant red cocktail dress and a friendly smile.

"So you're the new me?" she says looking you up and down "Gotta say, having some old dude living in my body? A little bit creepy."

"Hey, it wasn't exactly my first choice either." you say a little defensive "I guess they were all out of NFL quarterbacks and male models."

"Ha ha," she laughs, "You said it, buddy but thems the breaks. All sales are final, no exchanges, no refunds."

You nod in agreement. As strange as it was being Katie was far from the worse thing that could have happened.

"Listen, Katie." you say "I know this a dream and your just a product of my subconscious but I just wanted to say thank you. You've given me a second chance and I want you to know how much it means to me."

"Aw shucks," she giggles taking a hand off the wheel to land a playful punch on your shoulder "Weren't nothing but dying. Way I see it if I've gotta go may as well have some good come out of it."

"But you were so young." you say "It's not fair. You should have had more."

"No it ain't fair." she agrees "but that's not a call any of us get to make. All we can do is make the most of what we get. That's what I want you to do, make the most of it. Live this second life as best you can. Live it for both of us, you hear?"

Tears sting your eyes as you nod, too choked with emotion to speak.

"Hoo boy" Katie yawns "getting kind of tired here. Would you mind taking over a while?"

Suddenly you are sat behind the wheel, gripping it with Katie's dainty hands. You can feel the red dress wrapped around your slim body and glancing down you get a first-hand view of your own cleavage. Looking around you find the car is empty. You are all alone as you drive into a rising dawn.

The next day...

1212111.content:
The next day you are woken early by a porter bringing you a light breakfast and a change of clothes. You eat mechanically not really tasting the bland cereal as you reflect on the strangely vivid dream. You have never been a spiritual guy but you can’t help feeling you have Katie’s blessing somehow. Only halfway through your bowl, you start to feel full (a consequence of having a smaller stomach you assume) so you set it aside and pick up a coffee.

"Mmm, coffee how I've missed you," you say taking a moment to savour its rich aroma.

Before your illness, you had pretty much lived on coffee while you were sick it was on the long list of things you couldn't have. Carefully you take a sip of the scalding liquid only to gag at its harsh bitter taste.

"What the fuck” you complain “what's wrong with this coffee? It tastes like crap.”

A second cautious sip confirms it, the coffee is horrid, completely undrinkable but not because there is a problem with the drink itself. It's perfectly normal coffee, not the best you've ever had but still pretty much as you remember it. The problem is your new taste buds, they rebel with every sip. It seems you no longer like coffee, yet another unexpected side effect and not the last you are sure. Denied your morning cup of Joe you are forced to fall back on fruit juice and your recently acquired youthful energy.

You know the doc has a bunch of tests scheduled for today so you figure you should hurry and get ready. After the long months of your illness being scanned and poked and prodded by a succession of doctors is as familiar to you as brushing your teeth. After the doctor’s bombshell, you sit on the toilet struggling to keep your surging emotions in check. You've always prided yourself on being a rational person but now you can't stop yourself from crying. And not just a manly tear of regret but ugly choking sobs wrenching up from deep inside. Way down south in Austin, Texas.

"Well at least it's not New Jersey." You mutter. Looking at the University fields of study.

"Archeology....." You muse over it. Traveling had been a big thing to you growing up, but you never had the money. Also you remeber your childhood fantasy of going to Egypt, digging up dinosaur bones, and, treasure hunting. All of it was so surreal. You had to do it.

"All right Miss.Heatherton, we are going for an archeology degree." You say to yourself in a very cocky attitude. Living out your dreams was something you have given up. Since you had a wife, but couldn't have children, you had no commitment. This dream was in reach as you pulled up from the booth you went to the counter seeing a man about your age tending it. "Might as well try to get a job here it close to home and the college." You think.

"Hey little lady! Can I help you?" He said in a very projected voice. He was very tall, dark and, handsome. Your body involuntarily heated up. Getting a little flushed at him. His name tag read Eduardo Hernandez. A little stubble on his face. And we'll groomed head of hair.

"Yes, I was looking a job. Wondering if your hiring?" You say, playing with your ponytail. Looking at his eyes.

"Oh I'll have to check with the boss lady. But can you fill out this application." He reaches under the counter to bring out a paper and a pen. As you fill it out he asks you the basic questions about hours and where your going to school at. You finish it quick. But not after finding out he has a boyfriend, which somehow leaves you slightly dejected.

"Yeah Adam works at the tailor shop on Wilsoe street, if not here I can hook you up there at least." he says.

"Adam is hiring?" You ask sounding a little unsure.

"Yeah well he does dresses and suits. He needs a model and some hands. You know, I thought I'd ask since some of our regulars employees are leaving and a new batch is coming in. We have a lot of applications to sort through so we will call you in a week." He says.

"All right you say. And by the way Eduardo, my name is Eva. You can consider me a regular." You say with a bright smile. He laughs and soon your on way home. Kicking off the boots, eating a light meal, showering and finally sleeping a little better knowing your going into archeology.

"Maybe I can be the sexy professor too." You joke. Soon you sleeping today was exhausting for Eva.
15512.title: archaeology

There's no denying the sexiness of your new body. The clothes you woke in, the sexiest thing you've ever seen on a woman. It's unsettling, how you fill them to perfection, and how they display your body.

info.brief_description: You are diagnosed with a fatal illness. Your only hope is a new machine that swaps memory
info.description:
You are a divorced man who has lost most everything. You work hard as a stock broker but money is all you have to show for your 39 years of life. One day at work you collapsed and rushed to the hospital only to find you had just weeks to live..

You are given only one hope. The hospital you are at is a teaching hospital working on a new program to develop a mind transfer device. But they need to find a body that is comatose to transfer you into. Someone with no ties or connections that they can place your memories into. There is little hope and bed ridden and in and out of consiousness you pray they find a body.... Any human body that will give you another chance at life...
